required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of an Orally Administered Medication When Taken in Conjunction With Pramlintide

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, single-blind, placebo-controlled, crossover study to examine the effect of pramlintide on the pharmacokinetics of an orally administered medication

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the effect of pramlintide on the PK of an oral medication
primary_outcome.description: To determine the effect of pramlintide on the pharmacokinetics of an orally administered concomitant medication (acetaminophen) when administered at various times in relation to subcutaneous (SC) pramlintide dosing. The noncompartmental plasma acetaminophen pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters used in the analyses are defined as follows: AUC(0-12hr): Area under the plasma acetaminophen concentration-time curve. Cmax : The peak acetaminophen concentrationd. Tmax : Duration from the time of acetaminophen dosing to the time of the first maximum observed concentration, Cmax. tÂ½: Terminal half-life The primary study endpoints include: pharmacokinetic parameters AUC(0-12 hr) and Cmax of plasma acetaminophen concentrations Secondary Study Endpoints pharmacokinetic parameters Tmax and t1/2 of plasma acetaminophen concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: safety and tolerability as measured by analysis of laboratory values and adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: To assess safety and tolerability of pramlintide SC injection, including adverse events, as a function of the timing of an orally administered concomitant medication (acetaminophen).

arm_group.description: Pramlintide acetate (AC137) injection is a clear, colorless, sterile solution for SC injection. It consists of pramlintide in sodium acetate buffer, pH 4.0, containing 43 mg/mL mannitol as an iso-osmolality modifier and 2.25 mg/mL metacresol as a preservative. The strength of pramlintide injection is 0.6 mg/mL
Placebo solution is the same, sterile preserved formulation, except the active ingredient, pramlintide, is omitted

intervention.description: Clear, colorless, sterile solution for SC injection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with diet and/or oral agents
- HbA1c 6.5-11.0
